text: This has to be one of the most bizarre startups I've seen recently. I can't imagine how the pitch meeting went for this self-driving unicycle.
I heard it went something like: "We are revolutionizing personal transportation by combining the elegance of the unicycle with the convenience of self-driving technology!" 😂
And then they added, "Why settle for two wheels when you can have one?" 🤣
Finally, a mode of transportation for those who want the self-driving experience but can't afford a Tesla!
Can't wait for the inevitable self-driving unicycle vs Tesla showdown on YouTube.
I'm placing my bets on the unicycle. It's got that underdog charm.

Are they using the same LIDAR and computer vision technology as other self-driving vehicles, or have they come up with a completely new approach to deal with the... unique challenges a self-driving unicycle would face?
They're probably using some top-secret, proprietary technology that involves a combination of LIDAR, computer vision, and a highly skilled circus performer. 🎪
I can't help but think of the potential chaos these self-driving unicycles could cause on the streets. I'm just picturing them swerving around pedestrians and other vehicles with no warning.
Don't worry, they've got it covered. I heard they're working on a pedestrian detection system called "UniWatch," which also doubles as a unicycle-based neighborhood watch program. 😜
I wonder if there's a market for self-driving unicycles, or if it's just a gimmick. The concept is definitely unique, but is it practical?
I think it might just be the next big thing in transportation. I mean, who wouldn't want to ride around on a self-driving unicycle while sipping their morning coffee and browsing Hackernews? 🦄
